item.description:
As part of New Haven's International Festival of Arts & Ideas (link), we'll be seeing Provenance on the Mainstage at Long Wharf, a performance of music inspired by the Iberian Golden Age of Spain, when Muslims, Jews, & Christians all lived together in peace. It will be all new compositions by composers from Israel, Palestine, Algeria, Morocco, Iran, & the U.S. Led by world-famous cellist Maya Beiser, along with percussion, oud (sort of like a lute), ney (Persian flute), vocals, & electronics.

To learn more about the show, hear some sound clips, and see Maya's website and MySpace page, visit the Festival event page (link).

The performance is followed by an optional, free discussion with the artists.

I'd recommend buying tickets in advance, since some shows do sell-out. Though if you wait for the day-of (1st half of day), you might score a half-off "Rush" ticket in-person at the box office (if you get one at all).

PRE-PARTY: I don't know yet if I'll be up for dinner before. If you're interested, call me or text me, and I'll get back to you about it.

HOST: Jason, cell #203-901-4957 (calling or texting is fine)

TICKETS: For this event, certain seats are only sold via the Shubert (link), other seats are only sold through Long Wharf (link), or I believe you can buy at the door (if there are seats left). Tickets go from $20 on up. We already have our $20 tickets since we didn't want to miss-out. If you want to try to get tickets near us, we're in Section A, I think row E, seats 5 & 6.

DIRECTIONS: Directions to Long Wharf are here.

If you want to arrange car-pools, chat about the event, etc, click here to visit the thread on the message board
item.name: Tue. 6/24 - Arts & Ideas: Provenance, + discussion
